title: [Bug] from_dict 中 created_at 和 updated_at 使用 str() 转换会将 None 转为字符串 'None'，导致语义不一致
summary: Issue analysis revealed the code was already correct. The pattern `str(data.get('created_at') or '')` correctly handles None values because operator precedence evaluates `None or ''` to `''` before applying `str()`. Regression tests added to prevent future issues.

assessment.reason: Current code `str(data.get('created_at') or '')` correctly converts None to empty string due to operator precedence: (None or '') = '', str('') = ''. The issue description may have been based on a misunderstanding of Python operator precedence.

recommendations: Merge regression tests to prevent future issues
Close issue as 'works as intended' with explanation
